analysis.description: The Sentiment Model (Model C) code is valid but currently effectively broken in production because it lacks live data sources. It is running in 'Mock Mode', generating fake sentiment scores, which means its predictions are not based on reality.

issues.detail: Twitter API v2 requires expensive credentials. NewsAPI is free but likely not configured in .env. System defaults to static mock data.
The main scanner uses 'LiveFeatureExtractor' (22 features). The 'SentimentFeatureExtractor' (28 features) is a separate class and not the default. You must explicitly switch models to use it.

fix_steps.name: Get Free/Cheap Data Source
fix_steps.action: Sign up for NewsAPI.org (Free) or a RapidAPI Twitter scraper (Cheap/Free tier).
fix_steps.instruction: Get an API Key from https://newsapi.org/register.

fix_steps.name: Configure Environment
fix_steps.instruction: Add line: NEWS_API_KEY=your_key_here. For Twitter (optional): TWITTER_BEARER_TOKEN=...

fix_steps.name: Switch Pipeline to Sentiment Model
fix_steps.action: Point the 'latest' symlinks to the sentiment model artifacts.
fix_steps.instruction: cd models && ln -sf catboost_sentiment_v1_latest.pkl catboost_v1_latest.pkl (and scaler/calibrator/metadata)

fix_steps.name: Verify Live Data
fix_steps.action: Run the fetcher in 'news' mode to prove it gets real headlines.
fix_steps.instruction: python3 src/data/sentiment_fetcher.py (Edit the file to default to mode='news' first for testing)

recommendation: Use NewsAPI first. It's free and easier than Twitter. Real news is better than mock data.
